EDA on NYC Car Accidents Chapter 1 Introduction

EDA on NYC Car Accidents YOUR NAMES HERE 2021-04-06 Chapter 1 Introduction There are many car accidents in New York State(NYS) everyday. From the government website, we are able to download years of data about daily car accidents in NYS. Variables are in three main categories: case information, individual information and Vehicle information. In this project, we will merge the dataset for the three categories, merge and clean them, and perform exploratory data analysis on the features related to the number and severity of car accidents.

Chapter 2 Data sources 2.0.1 Sources: https://catalog.data.gov/dataset/motor-vehicle-crashes-vehicle-information-three-year-window https://catalog.data.gov/dataset/motor-vehicle-crashes-individual-information-three-year-window https://catalog.data.gov/dataset/motor-vehicle-crashes-case-information-three-year-window 2.0.2 Description These three sets record vehicle accidents in States of New York from 2017 to 2020. Data are from US government public data. The three sets contain different attributes about each vehicle accident reported to NYS DMV. There are three aspects: vehicle, individual information and case information. Case ID is the common key attribute across three sets. Variables include Case Vehicle ID, Vehicle Body Type, Action Prior to Accident, Direction of Travel, Vehicle Year, State of Registration, Number of Occupants, Vehicle Make, Contributing Factor, Event Type, Driver Age, Weather Condition, Lighting Condition, Date, Week and so on
Chapter 6 Interactive component 6.1 Up-and-Down Trend of Monthly Number of Accidents in New York State

Chapter 6 Interactive component 6.1 Up-and-Down Trend of Monthly Number of Accidents in New York State This D3 animated plot is inspired by the bar chart of the monthly accidents. There is an obvious up-and down trend across years. The number of accidents is higher in the beginning, middle and the end of the year. Though the static plot can show this trend, here we want to visualize this trend in a more compelling and animated way.
